column4: Oh, one more thing.ï»¿ When I install the program with "apt-get install mplayer", where is it saved in the Ubuntu partition and how do I run it, eventually put a shortcut in the taskbar?
oh, silly me. Thank you eljaco!
the executables are usually in /usr/bin but to run it you normally just use the app anme in a terminal
it would depend on the app
its ok, what app are you referring to?
i believe       'mplayer'    would run it from the terminal
or theres probably a launcher in    Applications--> Sound&Video--> mplayer
it does! Yes, and the launcher is there too.
if you want a launcher on the desktop or panel just drag and drop from the menu
yes that's all I know for now, drag and drop and pppoeconf hahaha
if you have anymore questions, dont hesitate to ask ;~)
ethernet or wifi?
ethernet
try    sudo eth0 down
thank you for that tip. Would it reset my IP address? How do I get it running again?
sudo eth0 up      or the network manager in the top right hand corner of your screen
use    ifconfig        to find your gateway, if your connected just use the address in your browser as per usual

I used "ifconfig". It listed eth0, local loopback and Point-to-Point protocol. There were several IP addresses, tried them all in Firefox and it didn't open anything. Can I somehow change the gateway to the ethernet modem?
have you tried pinging it to see if your connected? do you have the internet?
pinging what? I have the internet, otherwise I couldn't get to IRC ? :)
run this       sudo ping -c 10 192.168.1.1
it didn't return anything. :-/  but I am connected, firefox works and I downloaded some codecs seconds ago...
mind if i pm you?
of course i don't
